result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on December 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Date and time set for a plea hearing.

Atty Roehr is requesting an adjournment, her client is ready to take the plea but needs more time to sort out the details.
No objections.
COURT grants adjournment.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Heather Roehr

Bond to be Co-signed by Defendant's Mother (C.E.) No contact with victim(s): WF. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. No bars, taverns, liquor stores, or beer tents. No driving without valid dl. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:06 pm 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty Heather Roehr. 
Reading Waived. Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved. 

Argument re: bond. 
COURT ORDERS: $1000 cash bond - CONDITIONS: 
- Co-signed by deft's mother (C.E). 
- No contact with victim(s): WF. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. 
- No bars, taverns, liquor stores, or beer tents. 
- No driving without valid dl. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. 

BRANCH 3 CASE. 
RH: 3/18/2022 at 1pm in Courtroom B. 
Prelim: 3/23/2022 at 9:30 am in Br. 4.
